ygData.subject: Re: Madrid is now beachfront property.
ygData.msgSnippet: Wowie, I didn t expect it to do THAT much damage! And I think the Alliance base is on an island that doesn t exist in present times. ... Zardus smiles,

Wowie, I didn't expect it to do THAT much damage!

And I think the Alliance base is on an island that doesn't exist in 
present times.

::Zardus/Astral/Recklessa/Griplash/Fenox/Starlight/Slayer/Havoc::

Zardus smiles, watching the shore being destroyed. He couldn't see 
through all the ash and debris, but he knew that there were lots of 
casualties there. He stood still, waiting for everything to settle.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Astray yells as the air around him seems to shake with the force of 
the destruction below. It fuzes out, sending him plummeting toward 
the sea below.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Recklessa fires several shots at Slayer, seeing Astral plummeting 
toward the sea. She changes course, catching him several feet above 
water.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Fenox continues flying up, her jetpack continuing to function.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Griplash swears as his jetpack burns out, sending him plummeting 
toward the sea. He dives in, making a big splash as he does so.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Starlight's jetpack malfunctions, leaving her flying toward the 
ground. She transforms into beast mode, the wasp flying up away from 
the land.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Slayer looks to the left, watching the shore being destroyed. He's 
hit by several bolts, but continues flying upward.

"Prebon, what are your orders?" he asks over his comm.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Havoc smiles, watching from the safety of the Alliance island as the 
shore is destroyed.





--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> I'll start replying to Zardus
> 
> > Zardus raises an eyebrow at Prebon's reply. "I don't think 
attacking
> > a full powered battle cruiser, especially with only five bots on 
your
> > side, is very logical. But I do have a more logical solution, if 
you
> > care to listen."
> 
> Prebon listened to Zardus' comments about the logic of his actions, 
the
> battle seemed to be going his way so it seemed logical for Zardus 
to try to
> find a safe way out. "I'm a sensible bot, I'm always interested in 
hearing
> logical sollutions." He replied to the tyrant aboard the Iron Fist.
> 
> OK Yan, you must be in the Balearic islands (For reference sake.)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> The turret from the Alliance ship strikes the coast with devastating
> results. a cloud of dust and sand fills the air blocking Prebons 
point of
> view. "By the pit what have you done?" Prebon shouted through the 
noise of
> the explosion. Prebon had designed the attack as a recon assault to 
learn
> more about the Iron fists defenses, he hadn't imagined that it's 
main
> weapons were still operational. this threw a new twist on the whole 
war.
> 
> When the smoke cleared there was nothing left of the beach except 
ash. he
> tried to raise the others over the comm but only found three active 
signals.
> (Blaze, Ignatius and if you like Slayer.)
> 
> 
> > Fenox spins out of the way of the missiles, firing several shots 
back
> > at them to make sure they didn't come back around. She looked 
ahead,
> > two shots from Blaze slamming into her left shoulder. Diving down,
> > she flies under Blaze, firing up at the bot as the shore below 
them
> > is destroyed.
> 
> The shots hit Blaze, damaging her flightpack. the shockwave from 
the blast
> did the rest. She plummeted to the ground crashing harder than a 
Delta jet.
> Her body was torn with cuts and dents from the beating she'd taken.
> 
> Blaze voice came through a static filled channel. "Prebon, what did 
you lead
> us into?" It was rare to hear such tone from his troops, The female 
had used
> his name without a title before it. The chain of command was 
falling around
> him,(Or is that fallout?) The Trainers commander was no longer in 
control of
> his troops fate.
> 
> The new shoreline was smoking with residual energy when a hand 
washed up on
> it, It was Hammers, the proud warrior had fallen to a superior 
force. His
> spark may have survived but if it had it was buried somewhere in the
> aftermath of the devastation. (Hammer is dead)
> 
> Bullet's battle scarred frame lay a few miles inward from where the 
blast
> had hit, He lay in Stasis lock with holes through him that made him 
resemble
> swiss cheese. One leg was broken, the other was in pieces scattered 
from the
> focal point to the landing point. his arms were slung about like a 
puppet
> after the strings were cut. His face resembled the aftermath of a 
Mike Tyson
> fight, his left eye was melted shut, right eye hanging by a wire. 
Nose was
> dented inward from the force of the blast. his jaw had been broken 
open and
> half fallen off. One ear was still intact while the other looked as 
if
> someone had taken a bite out of it.(Completing the Tyson reference.)
> 
> > Havoc fires two more missiles at Bullet. Even though he couldn't 
see
> > him, he could easily pick him up with the scanners
> 
> The missles entered the cloud of debris and exploded.(Whether they 
hit or
> not seems pointless after the previous paragraph.)
> 
> > The Iron Fist continues to fire its defences, missile launchers 
and
> > laser bolts streaming out toward the trainers, a missile toward 
each
> > one, along with a dozen or so bolts.
> 
> Ignatius is struck by a series of bolts sending him tumbling into 
the sea,
> his wings were broken so he couldn't fly and transforming was 
pointless. He
> remained fully awair of the world around him as he tailspinned to 
what could
> be a wattery grave.
> 
> Missles and bolts struck all around the Trainers leader as he 
scrambled for
> any cover he could find. He had been thoroughly seperated from his 
team and
> that was the only fact that had kept him functional.
> 
> - Original Message -----
> From: <Yanshosh@a...>
> To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
> Sent: Friday, December 29, 2000 8:19 PM
> Subject: Re: attacking the alliance
> 
> 
> > Allrighty, so your troops are on the beach three miles away? Time 
to
> > use the main turret!
> >
> > Cyberwolf sent me an email saying that he wouldn't be able to post
> > till Monday and that I had his chars till he's back, but it wasn't
> > very clear when he was leaving, so if he doesn't post tomorrow, I
> > guess I get the Trainers for now.
> >
> > ::Zardus/Havoc/Lavacons/Slayer/The Iron Fist::
> >
> > Zardus raises an eyebrow at Prebon's reply. "I don't think 
attacking
> > a full powered battle cruiser, especially with only five bots on 
your
> > side, is very logical. But I do have a more logical solution, if 
you
> > care to listen."
> >
> > He smiles, noticing that the attackers were on the beach. Zardus 
taps
> > a few buttons on his wrist comp.
> > ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> > Recieving several commands from Zardus's wrist comp, the Iron Fist
> > activates its main cannon. A panel slides aside on the top of it, 
and
> > a mean looking large cannon slides out. It aims at the shore of
> > Spain, three miles away, where most of the attackers were.
> >
> > A wide glowing beam emerges from the cannon, making its way with
> > great speed toward the beach. It hits land in three seconds, with
> > more energy than it had used last time during its demonstration of
> > destroying a whole mountain.
> >
> > The shockwave from the blast reaches even the Alliance base, 
although
> > the cannon was designed not to leave a big shockwave. Water rushes
> > into the beach, which was now little more than smoking rocks. 
Hissing
> > and steam rise up as cold water hits the rocks, making the area
> > completely impossible to see through, although the Iron Fist's
> > scanners were not affected by the water. The beach was destroyed.
> >
> > The Iron Fist continues to fire its defences, missile launchers 
and
> > laser bolts streaming out toward the trainers, a missile toward 
each
> > one, along with a dozen or so bolts.
> > ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> > Havoc stares in surprise as the Iron Fist destroys the shore of
> > Spain. Several shots hit the shields in front of him, reminding 
him
> > that he was in a battle.
> >
> > Havoc fires two more missiles at Bullet. Even though he couldn't 
see
> > him, he could easily pick him up with the scanners.
> > ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> > Astral yelps as the beach that he was flying over is destroyed. He
> > doesn't see the shots, and two of them slam into his leg. He 
growls,
> > flying upward and waiting till he could see again.
> > ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> > Fenox spins out of the way of the missiles, firing several shots 
back
> > at them to make sure they didn't come back around. She looked 
ahead,
> > two shots from Blaze slamming into her left shoulder. Diving down,
> > she flies under Blaze, firing up at the bot as the shore below 
them
> > is destroyed.
> > ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> > Starlight dived out of the way, the bolt from Bullet grazing her 
back
> > and leaving a wide scorch mark on it. She growls, taking out her
> > charge launcher and firing two charges at Bullet. The charges 
lock on
> > magnetically, zooming through the air to their target.
> > ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> > Slayer erupts from the water, a mad-looking Recklessa flying after
> > him seconds later.
> >
> > "Yes, I'm perfectly fine," he replies, spinning in the air to 
avoid a
> > missile from Recklessa. Several bolts from the Iron Fist nearly 
hit
> > his head.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > > Prebon recieved Zardus' transmission. "They're still able to
> > communicate?
> > > Itold Blaze to make sure to eliminate that possability." He 
wasn't
> > happy
> > > about how disorganized this organized attack was becoming, his
> > trainers were
> > > working well together but were still being sloppy. "Hello 
Zardus,
> > you have
> > > an impressive ship, I must admit for Predacon technology it has 
it's
> > > advantages." he didn't want to keep the line open or he knew 
that
> > the ships
> > > defenses would lock on to him but he couldn't help to gloat. "I
> > function for
> > > the fight, I'm programmed for battle, and I attack you because 
it
> > is the
> > > most logical strategic move for this battle. Unless of course 
you
> > have a
> > > more logical solution."
> >
> >
> >
> >
